title: Trump Says U.S. Oversight of Venezuela Could Last for Years
summary: In a wide-ranging interview with The New York Times on Wednesday, President Trump said “only time will tell” when it comes to how long the United States aims to control the country.

title: An Oval Office Viewing
summary: During an interview with our reporters, President Trump discussed a video of an ICE agent fatally shooting a woman in Minneapolis.

title: Venezuela Announces the Release of Political Prisoners
summary: The release, which was expected to happen later on Thursday, offers the first gesture of conciliation under an interim government, even as arrests and crackdowns continue.

title: Colombia’s President Feared a U.S. Attack. Then Trump Called.
summary: The conversation appeared to defuse a crisis that erupted after President Trump said military action against Colombia “sounds good.” President Gustavo Petro spoke to The New York Times just before the call.

title: Rubio Says He’ll Discuss Greenland With Danish Officials Next Week
summary: Secretary of State Marco Rubio told reporters he would speak with the officials after days of mounting threats from the Trump administration to take Greenland, a semiautonomous Danish territory.

title: Minn. Officials Say They’re Being Blocked From Investigating Fatal ICE Shooting
summary: Federal officers fired tear gas to disperse early-morning protesters as outrage mounted in Minneapolis over the killing of a 37-year-old woman in her vehicle.

title: Trump Administration Deploying More Border Patrol Agents to Minnesota
summary: More than 100 agents will be redirected from other cities after the fatal shooting of a woman in Minneapolis by an ICE officer.

title: We Pressed Trump on His Conclusion About the ICE Shooting in Minneapolis. Here’s What He Said.
summary: The exchange was a glimpse into the president’s reflexive defense of his federal crackdown on immigration.

title: Minnesota’s Dispute With Trump Administration Boils Over After ICE Shooting
summary: The contradicting accounts of the ICE shooting in Minneapolis from the federal government and officials in Minnesota were the latest episode in a dispute that has been building for weeks.

title: U.S. Trade Deficit Fell to Lowest Level Since 2009 as Tariffs Reshape Trade
summary: The monthly trade deficit continued to shrink in October after President Trump imposed sweeping tariffs on imports, the latest data showed.

title: The Smithsonian Faces New Pressure to Submit to Trump’s Will
summary: The institution, long regarded as independent, is facing a White House deadline to hand over records about its content and will see turnover that could reshape its governing board.

title: Prosecutors Said to Pursue New Investigation of Letitia James
summary: The New York attorney general’s longtime hairdresser has come under scrutiny as the Justice Department’s efforts to charge Ms. James on other fronts falter.

title: Judge Bars U.S. Attorney in Albany From Inquiry Into Letitia James
summary: Ms. James, New York’s attorney general, had been seeking to block a Justice Department investigation into her office by challenging the legitimacy of the U.S. attorney, John A. Sarcone III.

title: Gov. Gavin Newsom to Criticize Trump in State of the State Address
summary: Gov. Gavin Newsom will portray his state as “a beacon” of democracy in a State of the State address that suggests national ambitions.

title: Josh Shapiro Begins a Re-election Bid That Carries Implications for 2028
summary: The Pennsylvania governor starts out as a clear favorite, but Republicans are trying to make him sweat.

title: Dav Pilkey, the Man Behind ‘Dog Man,’ Aims to Please
summary: “I’m writing for the kid I used to be,” says Dav Pilkey, who defied expectations to create three blockbuster graphic-novel series.

title: Brown Shooting Suspect’s Descent from Brilliant Friend to Angry Loner
summary: After Claudio Neves Valente was accused of killing two Brown students and a M.I.T. professor, former classmates recalled how he yearned to go to M.I.T. himself and failed, adding to his growing list of resentments.

title: How One Death Underscores the Suicide Risk for Construction Workers
summary: The death of TJ Kimball was a private tragedy that underscores a widespread risk in the stressful field.

title: Apple’s John Ternus Could Be Tim Cook’s Successor as CEO
summary: John Ternus, a low-profile but influential executive at Apple, could be next in line to replace the company’s longtime chief executive, Tim Cook, if he steps aside.

title: The Scientists Making Antacids for the Sea to Help Counter Global Warming
summary: The world’s oceans are becoming dangerously acidic. A controversial proposal would raise the pH — by mixing chemicals into the water.

title: Mamdani Hosts Influencer Summit, Sidestepping Traditional Media
summary: A friendly summit at New York’s City Hall with digital content creators and social media stars symbolized the new mayor’s attitude toward the changing news media.

title: Hochul and Mamdani to Announce Road Map to Expand Child Care
summary: Gov. Kathy Hochul will appear with Mayor Zohran Mamdani to lay out a plan to expand free and subsidized child care in New York, which had been a central focus of his campaign.

title: Can Claire Valdez, a Mamdani Ally, Become New York’s Next Socialist in Congress?
summary: Claire Valdez, a New York assemblywoman, will face the Brooklyn borough president in a Democratic primary race to replace Representative Nydia Velázquez.

title: A Housing Boom Transformed This City. Mamdani Is Taking Notes.
summary: Mayor Zohran Mamdani is eyeing Jersey City, N.J., for ideas as he looks to address New York’s housing crisis. For residents, the surge in development has been a mixed blessing.

title: Kennedy Is Telling Americans How to Eat. It’s Not Crazy Advice.
summary: Newly released dietary guidelines emphasize protein and full-fat dairy.

title: My Grandfather Sexually Abused Countless Children. Could He Have Been Stopped?
summary: We spend billions of dollars on punishing child sexual abusers and far less on prevention. It’s not stopping the problem. We must rethink our approach.

title: NASA May Return Early From International Space Station After Medical Issue
summary: NASA said it canceled a spacewalk planned for Thursday after an astronaut had an undisclosed medical issue on the International Space Station.

title: Minimum Wage Rises in Some States as Workers Struggle With Basic Costs
summary: This year, for the first time, more Americans will earn a minimum wage of $15 per hour or higher than will earn the federal minimum of $7.25 per hour.

title: U.S Disasters Cost U.S. More Than $100 Billion in 2025
summary: A record-setting 21 thunderstorm events each caused at least $1 billion in damages, a sign that more people and property are in harm’s way.

title: A Major Springlike Storm Is on the Move. Here’s What to Expect.
summary: The next few days will bring the type of potentially dangerous weather more often found in March or April.
